column4: hi, i tried to install php 5, i got error message, check this out please, http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/35209/
Lemme get ya a link real quick
The command seems to be right but it says it needs dependencies
But you're trying to install PHP I was just implying if Apache was installed
try typing this: sudo apt-get install php5-common
apache was installed, and works like the how to's, but the php wont
, the result is php5-common is already the newest version.
sudo apt-get upgrade should upgrade those 18 packages
thank you, i have remove the conflict one, and try installing it again, i think it works, thanks
I haven't a clue on that never used vmware before
system >> administration >> network >> from there you should be able to configure your network
